required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Investigation of the MiStent Drug Eluting Stent (DES) in Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Investigation of a DES (MiStent™ System) With Sirolimus and a Bioabsorbable Polymer for the Treatment of Patients With De Novo Lesions in Native Coronary Arteries.

brief_summary.textblock: The DESSOLVE II clinical trial is to assess the safety and performance of the sirolimus-eluting MiStent for the treatment for improving coronary luminal diameter in patients with symptomatic ischemic heart disease due to discrete de novo lesions in the native coronary arteries.

detailed_description.textblock: The DESSOLVE II clinical trial is to assess the safety and performance of the sirolimus-eluting MiStent as compared to the Endeavor DES for the treatment for improving coronary luminal diameter in patients with symptomatic ischemic heart disease due to discrete de novo lesions in the native coronary arteries.

primary_outcome.description: Measured by the angiographic core laboratory as the difference between the post-procedure MLD in the treated segment (stented region) minus the MLD in the same region at follow-up
Defined as death, MI (Qwave and non-Q-wave) and TVR at 9 months post-procedure. Assessed on all patients with adequate follow-up at 270 days.

secondary_outcome.description: Achievement of a final in-stent residual diameter stenosis of <50% (by QCA), using the assigned device only.
Achievement of a final in-stent residual diameter stenosis of <50% (by QCA) using any percutaneous method.

Achievement of a final in-stent residual diameter stenosis of <50% (by QCA) using the assigned device (including any adjunctive devices) without cardiac death, MI or repeat revascularization of the target lesion pre-hospital discharge.

Q-wave MI (QWMI): requires one of the following criteria: development of new abnormal Q waves in ≥2 contiguous ECG leads not present on the patient's baseline (i.e., before intervention) in association with a >2x ULN elevation of CK levels; chest pain or other acute symptoms consistent with myocardial ischemia and new pathological Q waves in ≥2 contiguous ECG leads in the absence of timely cardiac enzyme data. Non-Q-wave MI (NQWMI):the elevation of CK levels (≥2 times ULN) with elevated CK-MB enzyme levels (≥3 times ULN) in the absence of new pathologic Q waves. Peri-Procedural MI post PCI:Q or non-Q-wave MI, as defined above, prior to hospital discharge, or CK-MB elevation >3xULN within 48 hours post -PCI, with a normal CK-MB at baseline.

TVR is defined as any repeat percutaneous intervention or surgical bypass of any segment of the target vessel (main branch or side branch). The target vessel is defined as the entire major coronary vessel proximal and distal to the target lesion, which includes upstream and downstream branches, and the target lesion itself.
Composite endpoint of cardiac death, target-vessel myocardial infarction (Q wave or non-Q wave), and clinically indicated target vessel revascularization
Composite endpoint of cardiac death, target-lesion myocardial infarction (Q wave or non-Q wave), and clinically indicated target lesion revascularization
The presence of an intracoronary thrombus that originates in the stent or in the segments 5 mm proximal or distal to the stent post-procedure

arm_group.description: The MiStent SES is a sirolimus-eluting absorbable polymer stent for coronary artery revascularization.
The Endeavor DES is an everolimus-eluting durable polymer stent for coronary artery revascularization.

intervention.description: The MiStent is a device/drug combination comprised of two components; a stent and a drug product (sirolimus within an absorbable polymer coating).
The Endeavor is a device/drug combination comprised of two components; a stent and a drug product (everolimus within a durable polymer coating).

outcome.title: Total Myocardial Infarct (MI)
outcome.description: Q-wave MI (QWMI): requires one of the following criteria: development of new abnormal Q waves in ≥2 contiguous ECG leads not present on the patient's baseline (i.e., before intervention) in association with a >2x ULN elevation of CK levels; chest pain or other acute symptoms consistent with myocardial ischemia and new pathological Q waves in ≥2 contiguous ECG leads in the absence of timely cardiac enzyme data. Non-Q-wave MI (NQWMI):the elevation of CK levels (≥2 times ULN) with elevated CK-MB enzyme levels (≥3 times ULN) in the absence of new pathologic Q waves. Peri-Procedural MI post PCI:Q or non-Q-wave MI, as defined above, prior to hospital discharge, or CK-MB elevation >3xULN within 48 hours post –PCI, with a normal CK-MB at baseline.

outcome.title: Clinically-driven Target Lesion Revascularization (TVR)
outcome.description: TVR is defined as any repeat percutaneous intervention or surgical bypass of any segment of the target vessel (main branch or side branch). The target vessel is defined as the entire major coronary vessel proximal and distal to the target lesion, which includes upstream and downstream branches, and the target lesion itself.

event.sub_title: STEMI anterior (caused by acute stent thrombosis)
spiral dissection from mid lad to the most distal
RDA prox. stenose (proximally from the stent)
coronary instent restenosis of a non-target lesion
restonosis in target vessel, proximal in-stent

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: reversible renal failure due to dehydration
aortic dissection complicated with anastomosis aorta

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
